alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:35AM PST until December 05 at 7:22PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 21.0 feet early this morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.0 feet on 02/22/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 300 PM PST.
